Description: Base, body and rim fragment of North Ionian pottery plate with low ring foot and horizontal rim; interior, yellow-cream slip: hook maeander band on rim; around outside of floor, lotus flowers alternating with groups of vertical tongues; in tondo: lotus-buds and lozenge-shaped leaves; red patches on alternate solid tongue and on lozenge-shaped leaves; exterior has six bands; band on stand-ring.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
"Naukratis G. J. Chester 1885" marked on the interior.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.730)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
